text: @stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins And as for your son…that is TERRIBLE that he had to experience that, and your family shouldn’t have gone through that. SOMA district has always had a HISTORY of violence/drug use/drug conflicts but you know what else is in SOMA? 850 BRYANT…mere blocks.

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins I am being bigoted?  Or are your feelings hurt? This coming from someone who from the beginning, came onto MY FEED and began delegitimizing my experience from JUMP, because you feel YOUR EGO trumps my expertise of real LIVED situations…
@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins Looking for it…I have hella photos in my phone, and—a LIFE.

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins You mean with you or on twitter?  Yes I can, but I do not have video of the explosion, which is what woke up the entire neighborhood.  This was not the first time either…they blew up my downstairs neighbors a few years ago door because he was a legal gun owner!
@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins Also why do the police have a monopoly on safety🤔?  Especially since their origins are looking for escaped enslaved Black people?

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins In conclusion, I will say that as someone who has paid taxes in SF my entire adult life, I am not getting, nor have I been getting what I am paying for.  Like any SERVICE, we should be able to explore other viable options.

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins Oh, and who was arrested and criminalized for the drug selling/use?  BLACK SF RESIDENTS DISPROPORTIONATELY, I went to middle school with kids whose suppliers were undercover SFPD…LOL but not really lol…

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins This also disproportionately affected black communities and people in SF brought on by law enforcement and other actors.  This is the history of SF policing YOU DON’T know about nor see, nor refuse to see.  Historically problematic.

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins If we are bringing up fentanyl OD, let’s ALSO talk about the War on Drugs, which I actually lived through in SF, where I saw, and other CHILDREN saw SFPD and law enforcement distribute drugs like crack in our communities.  This is a fact.

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins Let me say this…it must be so nice to sit on your hill in San Carlos and minimize people’s terrifying experiences regarding policing, over the course of a lifetime of living here…a literal tank rolling down ANY American street is terrifying, and A PROBLEM.

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins Okay so now we are talking about fentanyl overdoses.  Cool. Backtracking…Have you ever had a tank roll down your street?  I didn’t mention my discovery of said tank was preceded by several large explosions that blew up the neighbors door?  To smithereens?

@RWC53068155 @stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins This simply is not true.  This is what I wish most people knew.  I literally know people walking home from work, or school who look “suspicious” and are questioned, detained, even arrested.

@RWC53068155 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins It does not make the news, and it is a real thing that we go through, this is why we say that adding more police, means more of these targeting false arrests will happen to us.  It is terrifying, honestly.  Sorry for the long response.🎈

@RWC53068155 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins A few friends of mine are fighting to get these false arrests off of their records (the arrest is still on record,years later!!!) It is a real thing that happens here in SF.  Police targeting the Black community, and the only ones fighting back are us.

@RWC53068155 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins Not that I am aware of; however the reality is, that I, as a law abiding citizen have had a gun pulled on me by SFPD, FOR NO REASON.  Other (black people) I know have been violently arrested, only to be released the next day or days after.  No charges, no reason.

This was just ONE of the DUMBASS questions that #KentanjiBrownJackson was asked during her hearing…this question regarding identity, is courtesy of Raphael Cruz, the Canadian-born Hispanic man, who now goes by Ted. YOWZA!🥴 https://t.co/8v8x7HvTgy
Watching the historic confirmation hearings of #KetanjiBrownJackson is very triggering.  Those of us having worked in racist environments understand this.
@QTarantino_ NO! DO IT! NOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW!!!!!!!!!!! Audition, then audition again and again, you can do it!!!!
A lived experience is a form of expertise.
@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins “Weak sauce…” soooo 2007 but I digress… I was only following your lead…you attacked me initially…🗣🗣🗣KETTLE.

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins Furthermore…it is laughable that you would accuse me of throwing SFPD under a racism bus, when I just want an overall justice and safety system that can work for all of us, not only those of us who can afford SF, or those of us who can judge from San Carlos…😒

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins What do you know about the REAL lived Black experience in SF, and our relationship with SFPD?  (It shows you know nothing) I have actual video of SFPD riding down my street in an actual TANK terrorizing residents at 4am; this was last year..

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins I don’t know.  But I will say that I am 10x more likely to be arrested with low police staffing, what will that disparity be with more police?  I tell you it won’t be lowered.

@stuz5000 @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia @TinischHollins The low clearance of cases is not a new problem in SF, so it isn’t about low staffing.  Low staffing also does not constitute for the disproportionate aggressive arrests of Black residents, nor the fact that SFPD does not specify Latinx ethnicity of its arrestees…problematic AF.

@CJCJmedia Even more potentially insidious, is that SFPD is purposefully and falsely labeling Latinx arrestees as “Black” in an attempt to pad the Black arrestee demographic so when people look up the data, it looks like Black San Franciscans are committing more crime…

@CJCJmedia BLACK San Franciscans such as myself, are almost 10 times more likely to be aggressively arrested by SFPD.  SFPD is masking the Latino ethnicities of arrestees, hiding even more arrest disparities…frightening to see this data.
https://t.co/A1oIczwqlj
https://t.co/oAdQyX6VUB

Thank you to @RachelRMarshall @CJCJmedia & @TinischHollins for adequately representing the plight of Black San Franciscans, and how we are almost 10 times more likely to be arrested by SFPD, a nightmare we live through everyday. A thread: https://t.co/FxWgZ471lH

#JaneCampion reminds me of the white woman in education I’ve worked with…awkward, RACIST, mediocre; holding others below water to keep their power, privilege, and proximity to white supremacy afloat…white feminism at its FINEST. HELL!

In the #JanetJacksonDoc it was sad but not surprising to hear that upon moving to L.A., the neighborhood had a petition going to have the Jackson family removed from the area due to race.  At the time The J5, had a string of #1 hits. This wasn’t long ago. #CRT

@philipaklein @ishapiro @GeorgetownLaw There is a line between racism and open expression.  Why are ppl like y’all given positions of power if you don’t know the difference—learned men do not mince words.  Begs the question, how many “lesser” black women were denied opportunities from y’all and this institution?

@GeorgetownLaw @GeorgetownLaw where is the rest of your response?  What accountability will be taken?  @ishapiro needs to be fired for his racist tweets about black women.  Shouldn’t be pressured into this.

@ishapiro You are a very educated man, and are well aware of the words you use when you, speak/type/tweet. You insult us all by framing that tweet as “inartful”; you can’t even tell when you’re being racist, and KNOW how to frame a proper apology.   @GeorgetownLaw what y’all doing?!?

@Meaghan_M In middle school, my best friend’s sister worked at Blondie’s—she told us they had roaches.  It totally did not stop us from going to get free pizza after school during her shifts…such great memories.🥴😂
